section.title: Overview
section.para: The extension registry should be modeled after the OpenGL extensions registry: http://www.opengl.org/registry/ . The OpenStack extension registry serves the following purposes:

listitem.para: It provides a central repository for all OpenStack extensions organized by API.
It allows vendors to register vendor prefixes: (RAX, HP, etc.).

section.para: Note that this proposal is for a repository of extension specifications and not a repository of extension software or plugins for a particular OpenStack implementation. That is, the repository is implementation agnostic and may describe extensions supported by implementations other than the OpenStack reference implementations (Nova, Glance, Swift, Keystone).

section.title: Benefits of a centralized repository
section.para: Users of OpenStack APIs benefit from having a centralized extension repository. While we would like to encourage vendors to develop extensions in coordination with the OpenStack community, some vendors may opt to develop their extensions independently. Without a centralized extension repository, users would have to gather information from various vendor websites in order to burst from one cloud onto another. Adding to the confusion is the fact that vendor X may choose to provide support for an extension developed by vendor Y. It may, therefore, not be clear to users where to go to get information about an extension.

Extension authors also benefit from having a central repository. The repository can be used to determine whether an existing extension satisfies an author's requirements. This can help mitigate the problem of extension proliferation and it may provide an opportunity for authors of similar extensions to combine their efforts. Additionally, the repository may provide a means by which users can become aware of extensions not currently supported by their vendors, thus allowing them to lobby for such support.

section.title: Extension Registration
section.para:
The extension registration process closely follows the registration process developed by the Khronos group for OpenGL:
http://www.opengl.org/registry/doc/rules.html. When creating an extension the following steps should be followed:

formalpara.title: Determine if an existing extension can be used
formalpara.para: Reuse of an existing extension is encouraged as this helps prevent the unnecessary proliferation of extensions and provides a means by which popular extension can be promoted to the core. Additionally, it's possible that existing extensions have established client support.

listitem.para: If an extension with similar functionality exists, but does not entirely meet the authors needs, then authors are encouraged to collaborate on promoting the extension into a multi-vendor extension.

Finally, an extension may be under development but has not yet been released. Thus, authors are also encouraged to send an email to the OpenStack mailing list to see if anyone else is working on an extension with similar functionality.

formalpara.title: Determine if a multi-vendor extension is appropriate
Register a vendor prefix, if one has not already been assigned
Develop and write the extension specification
Freeze the specification and submit it to the registry
Make the registry the source of truth for the specification
